intro: Ionopsis paniculata, commonly known as the pink fairy fanflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Ionopsis paniculata thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
